title: Stop doing these 3 things to be a better worm farmer

tasks.task: Detailed inspection and maintenance of a worm bin.
subtasks: Checking the condition of the worm bedding and evaluating the feeding schedule.
Observing the activity levels and health of the worms.
Ensuring proper aeration and moisture balance in the worm bin.
Feeding appropriate and适量 food based on the worms' consumption.
Addressing common misconceptions about worm farming (impatience, overcomplication, excessive care).

tasks.task: Explanation of proper worm bin management.
subtasks: Educating viewers on realistic expectations of worm feeding rates and the role of biological activity.
Illustrating the process of adding new bedding and mixing food to optimize worm habitat.
Debunking common myths about worm care (soil moisture, dietary restrictions).
Discussing the importance of minimal disturbance to worms and adjusting feeding frequency accordingly.

tasks.task: Demonstration of worm bin layering and feeding techniques.
subtasks: Showing the process of adding food waste to different layers of the bin.
Mixing the food with bedding materials to facilitate decomposition.
Adjusting the bin layers to improve airflow and accessibility for worms.
Addressing the potential for and removal of partially consumed food items.
